'''Definition:''' a disease resulting from a deficit in the production of cortisol by the adrenal glands, which may be associated with a deficit in the production of aldosterone and adrenal androgen.

*Slow adrenal insufficiency results from chronic hormone(s) deficiency.
*Acute adrenal insufficiency results from acute hormone(s) deficiency.


'''Two types of adrenal insufficiency:'''

*Primary or peripheral adrenal insufficiency (involvement of both adrenal glands):
**or Addison's disease
**Adrenal cortisol deficiency associated with aldosterone and adrenal androgen deficiency.
**
*Corticotropic or central adrenal insufficiency (pituitary involvement):
**Deficient production of pituitary ACTH leading to a failure to stimulate adrenal cortisol production.

question.title: What is adrenal insufficiency in adults and children?
question.description: A disease resulting from a deficit in the production of cortisol by the adrenal glands, which may be associated with a deficit in the production of aldosterone and adrenal androgen.

option_a.title: A disease resulting from a surplus of cortisol by the adrenal glands
option_a.description: A condition where the adrenal glands produce too much cortisol

option_b.title: A disease resulting from chronic hormone deficiency
option_b.description: A condition where the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones

option_c.title: A disease resulting from acute hormone deficiency
option_c.description: A condition where the adrenal glands do not produce hormones due to a sudden lack

option_d.title: A disease resulting from a deficit in the production of cortisol by the pituitary gland
option_d.description: A condition where the pituitary gland does not produce enough ACTH to stimulate adrenal cortisol production

correct_option.title: b
correct_option.description: a disease resulting from chronic hormone(s) deficiency
